meanings.definition: To clean or wash something by flushing or flooding with water.
meanings.sent1: She rins the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent2: Remember to rins your hands before eating.
meanings.sent3: He always rins his car in the driveway, even when it's not dirty.
meanings.sent4: The rain rinsed the streets clean after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The river rinsed away the mud, revealing shiny rocks beneath.

meanings.definition: To remove soap or dirt by flushing with water.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the mud, she had to rins her clothes.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to rins the soap off completely.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally rinsed his hair with cold water, making him shiver.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain rinsed away all the dirt from the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall rinsed the rocks, making them glisten in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: She likes to rins her face with cool water in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The chef will rins the vegetables before cooking.
meanings.sent3: He rinsed the windows quickly before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: The gentle waves rinsed the shore, leaving behind seashells.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain rinsed the flowers, making them bloom brightly.

meanings.definition: To remove soap or dirt by flushing with water.
meanings.sent1: The child learned to rins his hands before meals.
meanings.sent2: She always rins her hair twice to make sure all the shampoo is gone.
meanings.sent3: He rinsed the paintbrush in the water, cleaning off the paint.
meanings.sent4: The river rinsed the pebbles, revealing their colorful patterns.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall rinsed the leaves, making them shine in the sunlight.
